executive_summary.product_vision: A state-of-the-art, dual-audience financial intelligence platform that revolutionizes fraud detection through advanced AI technologies, serving both professional financial analysts and individual consumers.
executive_summary.mission_statement: To democratize financial fraud detection by providing institutional-grade AI-powered analysis tools to financial professionals while empowering consumers with accessible personal security solutions.
value_proposition: Next-generation fraud detection using GraphRAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation with Knowledge Graphs)
Local-first architecture ensuring data privacy and sovereignty
Dual-audience approach serving both analysts and consumers
Real-time analysis with sub-second response times
key_differentiators: Ollama integration for local LLM deployment (privacy-first)
Interactive network visualization of fraud patterns

success_criteria: Automated SAR generation in under 60 seconds

Embeddings + Metadata â†’ ChromaDB â†’ Store in sebi_documents collection

Multi-stage retrieval â†’ Search ChromaDB with all variations
Reranking â†’ BGE reranker scores documents
LLM generation â†’ Ollama/Claude generates answer
Display â†’ Streamlit renders answer + evidence
case_management_flow: Create case (UI) â†’ POST /cases (API) â†’ CaseManager.create_case()
Store in SQLite â†’ cases table
Run query â†’ POST /cases/{id}/analyze â†’ Execute RAG query
Save query + evidence â†’ case_queries + query_evidence tables
Generate SAR â†’ POST /cases/{id}/sar â†’ Comprehensive RAG query
LLM generates report â†’ Save to sar_reports table
Download â†’ GET /cases/{id}/sar â†’ Return report content

open_questions_and_decisions.question: Should we use Neo4j Desktop or NetworkX for graph database?
open_questions_and_decisions.recommendation: Start with NetworkX for rapid Phase 4 prototyping, migrate to Neo4j if graph exceeds 10K nodes

open_questions_and_decisions.question: What deployment platform for Phase 5?
open_questions_and_decisions.recommendation: Hugging Face Spaces for full feature support

open_questions_and_decisions.question: Should we open-source the project?
open_questions_and_decisions.recommendation: Open-source core engine, keep proprietary add-ons (enterprise features)

open_questions_and_decisions.question: How to monetize the consumer app (Phase 6)?
open_questions_and_decisions.recommendation: Free for consumers, B2B licensing for enterprise analyst tool

remaining_work: Phase 4: Implement GraphRAG with entity extraction and network visualization (6 weeks)
Phase 5: Deploy to cloud platform and finalize documentation (4 weeks)

conclusion.risks_and_mitigation: Primary risks include graph database performance, entity extraction accuracy, and LLM hallucinations. All risks have documented mitigation strategies and fallback options.
conclusion.recommendation: Proceed with Phase 4 implementation as planned. GraphRAG is the key differentiator and will unlock relationship-aware fraud detection capabilities. Target completion: December 2025.
